structure.unit: STATE LIBRARIES -- LIBRARIANS -- STATE ARCHIVES AND RECORDS

law.catch_line: Power to accept money appropriated and granted.
law.text: The Department for Libraries and Archives may accept and administer any money appropriated or granted to it, in addition to appropriations to it out of the general fund, for providing, improving, and equalizing public library service, library service to state institutions, and cooperative systems of library service, including cooperative arrangements with public school, college, university, and special libraries in Kentucky, by the federal government or by the state or any other agencies.
law.history: Amended 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 241, sec. 1. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2438d-1.
